{{Infobox NFL season | team = Denver Broncos | teamcolor = Denver Broncos 62thru96 | year = 1996 | record = 13â3 | division_place = 1st [[AFC West]] | coach = [[Mike Shanahan]] | general manager = John Beake | owner = [[Pat Bowlen]] | stadium = [[Mile High Stadium]] | playoffs = Lost AFC Divisional Playoff | uniform = }} The '''[[1996 NFL season|1996]] [[Denver Broncos]] season''' was the team's 37th year in professional football and its 27th with the [[National Football League]].

AP Offensive Player of the Year â Terrell Davis
UPI AFL-AFC Offensive MVP â Terrell Davis (1996 was the last year this award was given out)
Terrell Davis sets Franchise rushing record For Carries (345) in a season and touchdown's rushing (13) in a season
===Milestones=== Terrell Davis reaches 1,000yds faster than any Denver Bronco running back in Franchise history
